dialogues.text: Go on. You’ve earned it.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You're doing a great job. Oliver stumbles to the toilet. Gary smiles proudly.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: He didn’t make it this far last time. I’m proud of him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You're enjoying this aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, like I said, five friends, on a night out. Having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Pretending to have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Are you pretending?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: If we make it out of here alive, I'm going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: We're still in the dark, Gary.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah, our families could be in danger for all we know.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I know, my mum could be dead. For reals this time. Andy's glass shatters in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Look, why don't I just ask someone what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Who? Gary points to a familiar face; the SHIFTY LOOKING DEALER from the prologue. Older, better dressed, his hair greyin

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: The Reverend Green. Gary starts to walk over. Andy stops him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I am going to have a "little chat" with the Reverend Green.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You're going to buy drugs?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I am going to subtly check whether or not that is The Reverend and if it is, we can find out what's going on... and possibly buy some drugs.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: But what if he's one of them.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Me and The Reverend had a highly sophisticated code when discussing the purchase of narcotics. If he doesn't understand, it means he's one of them and I will walk away. Gary sidles up next to The Reverend Green and performs an elaborate sequence of knocks on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Have you got any drugs?

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: I don't do that anymore Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: That.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: That why you're in a suit? Drug dealing not good enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: There are no dealers anymore. I have a proper job in a proper office.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You had a proper office before. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: That was the men's toilet.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Nothing wrong with doing your business in the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: Things have changed since you left.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: How much do you know?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: How much is a little?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: The town has been taken over by robots full of blue stuff. The Reverend looks around in a panic and hushes Gary.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down, you have no idea what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Tell us then.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: They’re not robots. Do you even know what robot means?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah course, like... (robot voice) Hello, I ama robot.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: It means 'slave' and believe me, they are not slaves.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Are you being held prisoner?

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: No, I am very happy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Tell your face. Andy and Steven join in to whisper conspiratorially.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: There's been an invasion by robots who aren't robots and The Rev's their prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: I am not.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: We're leaving first thing. We can get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: I'm not going. This is not what you think. This is all for our benefit. The person next to them at the bar turns and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: You've said too much, Trevor. A second person turns and whispers harshly.

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: Yeah, put a cork in it Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: I’m trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: It’s not your place to help.

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: They will have everything in hand.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Are you guys robots??

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: Well the term robot actually comes from an old Czech word-

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: Robotnik. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: -meaning slave-

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: -and we are not slaves.

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: We are very, very happy.

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: And not 'robots'. Peter joins the bar.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh my god, are these guys robots?

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: Can we shut up about robots!

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: I say we shut up about everything! A GREEN ROTARY PHONE RINGS behind the bar. The Publican p up, listens without speaking and hands it to The Reverend

dialogues.speaker: PUBLICAN 6
dialogues.text: Trevor, it’s your supervisor. The Reverend’s shoulders sag. He takes the call. We brief hear a WELL SPOKEN VOICE on the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello Trevor...

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Yes sir... but... I understand. The Reverend hands the receiver back to the Publican and throws a forlorn look at Gary and company.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Thanks a bunch. The Reverend dejectedly walks off and disappears into the men’s toilet, just as a refreshed Oliver emerges.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: What did I miss?

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: Your friends trying to “help”. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: We don’t need “help”.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Well what should we do?

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: I suggest you get on your way.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I think we should do what they say.

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: I think you should do what we say.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I said that.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang move through the dark streets. A gleeful Gary striding at the front, the others stumbling behind.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Let's get in and out of here yeah? No more making new friends.

dialogues.speaker: PUBLICAN 7
dialogues.text: Ah gentlemen! The prodigal sons return! What will it be, one of our guest ales perchance?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Uhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: PUBLICAN 7
dialogues.text: Might I recommend five pints of Crowning Glory? Rather fitting, wouldn't you say, Gary?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The gang stare back at the Publican, bemused.

dialogues.speaker: PUBLICAN 7
dialogues.text: It's a delightful brew: hoppy, nutty, foamy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Does it have a surprisingly fruity note that lingers on the tongue?

dialogues.speaker: PUBLICAN 7
dialogues.text: Ah, you're obviously a connoisseur. Andy barks a laugh. If he were sober, it wouldn't be funn

dialogues.speaker: PUBLICAN 7
dialogues.text: Then you'll already know that it’s a rare treat for rogues, reverends, royalty and all good folks between.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Mmmmm, five of those, please.

dialogues.speaker: PUBLICAN 7
dialogues.text: Welcome home boys. AT THEIR TABLE, the drunk, confused gang stare at Publica

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Don’t remember him being that friendly.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: He’s obviously one of them.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: How can he be? He remembered me.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: We don’t know what they remember.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Maybe they have selective memories.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, like me.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s one of the others. Like The Reverend. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: It really is hard to tell, isn’t it.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Is he one of them or one of them?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wait, which ones are the thems?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: They’re both thems. But there’s two different ways of saying it. Is he one of them or one of them?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: We need different terms. One for the people who aren’t robots and one for the robots who aren’t robots.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Alright, we need to be able to differentiate between them, them and us.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think the pronouns are really confusing.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I agree. I don't even know what a pronoun is.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: It's a word that can function by itself as a noun that refers to something else in the discourse.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You just used one.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Did I?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah. "It" is a pronoun.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What is? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Is it? Andy takes a giant swig of his drink.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Look, we just need a word to identify who's who. He's a 'blank' she's a blank, those two people are definitely 'blanks'. As Steven says this, Sam walks in with THE TWINS.

dialogues.speaker: GARY/STEVE
dialogues.text: Sam. The sight of Sam brings Steven to his feet, but just as h about to approach her, Gary pushes him back down.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I got this, Steve. Gary leaves the table and sidles up to Sam at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Alright Sam?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: How’s your night going?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Good. Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Sort of?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's weird isn't it? You come back and everything's the same. But sort of... different.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Different how?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Just weird. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: How weird?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What are you getting at Gary? Gary suddenly bundles Sam off towards the disabled toilet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary slams the door behind them. Sam is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fuck's sake Gary, take a hint.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It's alright, I'm not trying to have sex with you.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Why are we in the disabled toilets then?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I need to tell you something right now, unless you do actually want to have sex, in which case I can tell you afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Tell me right now.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Did you notice anything creepy about The Twins apart from the fact that they’re twins?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Just because they’re twins doesn’t automatically make them creepy.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Does a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You had sex with them.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: No I didn’t. How did you know that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s a small town Gary and I’m not stupid and well, they told me.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Okay, I did once, but I was wasted, which did make it creepy, because it was like there was four of them. I am not proud. I ama bit.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: This is what you wanted to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: No, this is....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a SMACK. Sam emerges from the toilet without Gary

dialogues.speaker: THE TWINS
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I need a cigarette. Sam walks out to the beer garden. The Twins follow. BACK AT THE TABLE: The gang is deep in conversation.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Nobots?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: How about Fauxbots?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I think we should get away from the whole robots thing.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Steven? Steven sees a furtive Gary emerge from the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: What's he up to?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he's probably just trying to fuck Oliver's sister. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (chuckles ) Oh Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and The Twins sit at a picnic table. Sam sparks up.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: My god that man is full of shit. I know that's not a surprise to you.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWINS
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: He said Newton Haven has been taken over by robots full of blue stuff and if we they will don't do what they say, make us their prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWINS
dialogues.text: Did you believe him? Of course

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: not.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWINS
dialogues.text: Did you believe him? The Twins stare. Sam's smile fades. They look creepy. BAM! Gary knocks The Oh crumbs! One twin falls flat into a nearby hedge. Twin. He pushes her See? Sam stands in shock DECAPITATED HEAD in Twins over with a flying tackle.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: on her back, the other goes with Gary Sam sees him tussle with the flailing head down and POPS IT OFF. Sam yelps.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: as Gary holds the head aloft. Then, the his hand intones calmly.

dialogues.speaker: DECAPITATED TWIN HEAD
dialogues.text: Come on Sam, you know better than to believe Gary King. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gary SMASHES THE HEAD on the ground into a million pieces Before Sam can react, the other Twin grabs her hair and SMACKS HER HEAD on the picnic table. She then YANKS HER H BACK, flipping Sam hard onto the grass. The Twin then runs toward Gary and POUNCES ON HIM. Gary wrestles with the Twins, one with a head, attacking, one headless and convulsing.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Get off me you creepy bitches. Gary extricates himself from the m ™l ©e and shoulder cha one Twin into the other, sending them both crashing throu the hedge, through a fence and down an embankment. Gary walks over to Sam and seemingly extends a hand to he

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Chuck us a ciggie. Dazed, Sam hands Gary a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Gary, what's happening?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I told you in the disableds.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yes, you did. He hauls her up. They are covered in grass stains and twi

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We should get inside, people will wonder what the hell’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I got this, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Got what? They both turn to see an emotional STEVEN. Gary and Sam l at each other, unsure where to start.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Sam, he's not good enough for you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: We've been through some crazy shit tonight and it's really put things in perspective for me and if it's all as fucked up as it seems, then there's something I need to tell you and you might think this is because I've drunk seven pints of lager, but it's not. I'm in love with you Sam, I always have been and it breaks my heart to see you waste your affections on Gary King.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: That's a bit harsh.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh no, you've got it all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: And since I'm being honest, just to lay it out, I am currently seeing a fitness instructor but I - she's 26- years-old - but I would drop her in a heartbeat, if I thought I had one last chance with you.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There's nothing between me and Gary. WHAM! Gary and Sam are thrust apart by THE TWINBOT: An amalgam of the twins in one single body. It possesses two legs instead of two arms and looks very creepy indeed. Steven backs up shocked and falls over. The TWINBOT bears down, reaching out with its new legs to strike when- Gary reappears and LEAPS onto the creature, a split secon later Sam joins him, PUMMELLING it with a picnic umbrella

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Get your feet off her! Steven regains his composure and joins the mélée, using a picnic bench to LAUNCH himself onto the Twins. Their comb efforts topple the opponent to the ground. The three humans tussle with a chaos of flailing limbs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Pop its head off! Like an aspirin bottle. Steven emits an orgasmic yelp as he twists something out sight, we hear two pops then A LOUD CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Blue-bloods?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Nothing suggested in the last three minutes is better than ‘Smashy- Smashy Egg Men’. Nothing. Gary, Sam and Steve re-enter, all sweaty and grass staine

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Did you guys think of a name for the robots who aren’t robots?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m afraid we’ve drawn a ‘blank’.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Well we just had a barney with two ‘blanks’ in the beer garden.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We have to leave now!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Agreed. Let’s hit The Mermaid. Gary heads off, Oliver and Peter follow without question.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Wait? What! Andy speaks up. He is now very, very drunk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Gary thinks we should keep on with the crawl, because they know what we're doing but they don't know that we know what they're doing. And basically no one has a better idea so fuck it. Andy crashes through the door, leaving Steven and Sam beh

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What? Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary forges ahead like a drunken Gandalf, the others stumbling behind in his wake. Sam shouts after them.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Guys! I have a better idea. I'm parked right around here somewhere, let's just go! Steven, tell them!

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Gary says they'll get us if we try and leave now.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: We're way past leaving now. Come on. They arrive at The Mermaid. A chalk sign outside reads "SCHOOL DAZE: '80S, '90S'. Gary charges right on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud music. Bright lights. Oppressive bass. 'Step Back in Time' by Kylie Minogue blares in this pub disco. The plac packed with adults dancing in SCHOOL UNIFORM.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: This is a bit mad innit?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: This is perfect. We can hide out in here. I'll get the drinks in.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Good plan O-Man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Keep an eye out for blanks. The gang scans the dancing crowd. Gary quickly begins to his head to the beat. Sam shouts into Steven's ear.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Why did you never say anything?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: About what you said in the garden.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: I wanted to, Sam. It just never seemed like the right moment. Something always got in the way.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here you go, get these down you. Oliver appears behind Sam, laden with drinks. Sam knocks him causing a spill. At this precise moment- Steven is dragged through a doorway, out of sight by an unseen pair of hands. Sam turns back. Steven is gone.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Steven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven is bundled into the dark cloakroom filled with coa by a MYSTERIOUS FIGURE wearing a BALACLAVA.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Please! I have so much to live for! The mysterious figure whips off his balaclava.

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: It's me you numpty.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Basil!

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: I knew seeing your faces again would spell trouble. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: How do I know it's really you?

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: Because I'm the only one who's going to tell you the truth about Newton Haven. (clears throat) Now, do you recall the events of the evening of June the 22nd, 1990?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: No but I know a man who does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary nods his head to S-Xpress, ogling faux schoolgirls. and Peter nod along also. Oliver brings them their drinks

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: See anyone we know? The crowd parts. Dancing like sirens before them are-

dialogues.speaker: GARY /ANDY/PETER
dialogues.text: The Marmalade Sandwich. They look 17 not 40, as they appeared in the prologue.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: They look... young.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It's the lights.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It's the drink.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Who cares what it is? The gang drift onto the dance floor. Behind, Sam looks fo

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Steven?

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: That was the night they arrived. Remember the shooting star? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BASIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was them. Nothing happened at first. They were getting ready, burrowing in underground, preparing. Not long after you lot left, people started to change. One or two at first, then more. They replaced people of influence, taking over the institutions, remaking, remodelling, refurbishing. Doing everything they could to make us join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Join Our Club' by St. Etienne plays. Gary, Andy and Pete approach the Three Alluring Girls who draw them into clos hypnotic dancing. Oliver watches, smiling. Sam grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I can’t find Steven. Where are the others?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: They're blending in.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh crumbs.

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: It’s not like the replacements were evil, far from it. People got a lot friendlier. That’s how they do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary, Andy and Peter, drunk with lust, as the girls work like puppets. Sam shakes her head, but Oliver smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BASIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s not an invasion, it’s a merger. They don’t want to get rid of us, not if they can help it. They want us to be another link in their chain. Which is fine unless you say no.  80.

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: That’s when you get replaced. Once they get your DNA they’ve got you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: How do they do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary, Andy & Peter are worked by the Marmalade Sandwich. Erica Leeks licks Peter’s neck, Gary snogs Tracy Benson.

dialogues.speaker: BASIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Any way they like, blood tests, the nit nurse, sweat, kissing, saliva on the rim of a glass-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basil produces his curly straw.

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: Why do you think I drink with this crazy straw, not so crazy now is it? If you’re not on their side they’1l create a version that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy does his best to resist Becky's kisses. He shows her wedding ring, she sucks it off his finger and swallows it

dialogues.speaker: BASIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They can bring you back exactly the same or even make you young again. It looks like you, even has your memories but really it's just a vessel to spread their message. People you know, trust, love, respect, desire, replaced in the name of progress.  81.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: What happens to the people who get replaced?

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: The 'empties'? Don't ask me what happens to them.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Why, what happens to the empties?

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: I told you not to ask me that! Go! Get out, before it's too late! CREAK! The cloakroom door opens. Steven and Basil turn to a coat thrown in and the door just as quickly shut. When Steven looks back, Basil is gone...

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Basil? Basil appears from underneath the coat.

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: I said go!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: This can't be good. Sam, aghast as the Marmalade Sandwich tempt our heroes.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Sam, who was that boy you liked in sixth form? Adrian?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Adrian Keane. Why?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: He’s over there. Sam sees a HANDSOME YOUNG MAN in school uniform, standing a dark corner. He sees her, smiles and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN KEANE
dialogues.text: Hey Sam. How’s life? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam's own glass slips from her hand to smash on the floor Horrified, Sam turns to run and SLAMS right into-

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Where are the others?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They're blending in. Steven sees his friends being seduced on the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Fuck! Sam and Steven attempt to separate the couples.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Just to the end of the song.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Gary, she's a blank!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Don't be so judgmental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang bursts from The Mermaid. Oliver stops them.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Hold up. Where are you all going?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We're leaving!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Adrian Keane was in that bar.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I thought you liked Adrian Keane.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Prick.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Adrian Keane is dead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Adrian Keane died in a motorbike accident in Italy eight years ago.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Did he?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: They must have had his DNA on file. That’s how they were able to replicate him. They know how to get to us. Jesus, they know everything.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They didn’t know Adrian was dead.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: They know enough to tempt us. They knew these three would fall for 17- year-olds in school uniform.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Who wouldn’t? Am I right guys?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: We have to get out of town, get beyond it, before it’s too late.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Who’s given you these ideas?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Basil.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Oh Mad Basil? He of the Bermuda Rhombus and the Aqua Nazis?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Another good name for the band, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You're going to put our lives in the hands of a crazy old man?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: He’s not crazy! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Maybe he's not. Maybe he's a blank trying to lure us to the edge of town, onto those dark country roads where they can deal with us.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah, we could end up dead in a field. I hate fields. Sam is aware of the VARIOUS PASSERSBY watching them argue

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Steven's right. We should go.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: We're going to The Beehive. Gary's plan is still the best we have.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You know what? The 1990 model Oliver was out of commission by this point in the evening.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I like the new you. They walk off. Andy remains behind.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Andy, come on. Andy sways, staring at his ringless finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang approaches, running on alcohol and adrenalin. Pe drunkenly dancing down the street. Oliver leads the charg

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Here we go. Pub number nine.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Fuck yes! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: That's the spirit, Pete!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Spirits! We should get chasers.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Who is this guy? Sam and Steven approach The Beehive with more apprehensio

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: This is a mistake isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Just stick with me. Steven takes her hand. They enter. Andy lags behind.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Come on Andy! It can't start without you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Whuh?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: We can't start without you. Oliver goes in. The door closes. Andy catches his own reflection in the glass and stares. Something's not right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This pub is very busy, completely crowded with customers.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Now. Whose round is it?

dialogues.speaker: A VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's mine. At an empty table, surrounded by six vacant seats, sits t favourite teacher, MR. SHEPHERD, older but still cool looking. He awaits them with five beers and a vodka tonic

dialogues.speaker: GARY /PETER/STEVEN
dialogues.text: Mr. Shepherd!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Is it Mr. Shepherd? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Why don't you boys join me? Looks like you could do with a drink. The gang sit down, both comforted and unnerved by him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Now, let’s have a little chat about your future.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Mr. Shepherd?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Please, call me Guy.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Alright. Guy... Peter sniggers, Gary giggles but regains composure.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: .«..are you a robot?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Does anyone know what robot means? Gary's hand shoots into the air.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Ooh, me!

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Yes, Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It means ‘slave’.

dialogues.speaker: MR SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Very good Gary. Gary is pleased with himself.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: So, are you a robot, sir?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: No Peter, I’m not a robot. Steven puts his hand up.

dialogues.speaker: MR SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Yes, Steven. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: You're on their side though?

dialogues.speaker: MR SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: This isn’t about sides, Steven. It’s not shirts versus skins. It’s about working together as one team. The gang listen intently but are too drunk to take it in. They shuffle and mutter comments as if they are in class.

dialogues.speaker: MR SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: I know it seems weird and a bit scary but believe me, it's quite the opposite. They're here to help, kids. To straighten us out and prepare us for the big league. They've seen something in us, a potential, like the promise I saw in you. There's a vast community of worlds up there, living peacefully, cooperatively together. A network of unity and consistency and guess what? They want us along for the ride. Pretty cool, eh gang? The gang struggle to concentrate. Peter is now asleep.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: So, they're not here to harm us?

dialogues.speaker: MR SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Far from it O-Man, they're here to help. I'm not saying they're afraid to get tough. I've had to straighten you all out in my time. What one among you wouldn't thank me for it? They're much like teachers in a way. Stern, yes; frightening, sometimes. But it's all for our betterment. So, what do you say? Why don't we go somewhere and talk about this properly.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: King's Head?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Hang on, that wasn't properly? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Well it seems pretty clear to me, guys. What Mr Shepherd is saying, is that we - BANG! Andy has smashed Oliver's head right off with a bar stool. It flips back, attached by a bio-mechanical tendon

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Andy! What the fuck? Oliver's head flips back up. Face missing. Only his mouth remains. It speaks.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Yes Andy. What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: W.T.F
dialogues.text: Sam yells and kicks Oliver's stool over, knocking him dow Mr. Shepherd leaps up and smashes a FIRE ALARM. AS IT RIN HIS MOUTH BECOMES A CONDUIT FOR A BLINDING WHITE LIGHT. All other patrons turn to the gang, THEIR EYES AND MOUTHS ALIGHT. They talk as one, in a WELL SPOKEN VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: MEANS OF PERSUASION. NOW PLEASE -
dialogues.text: Andy grabs Mr. Shepherd's tie, pulls him into a VICIOUS HEADBUTT that completely smashes his head into pieces.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Guy! Andy rips his shirt off, picks up two bar stools as blunt weapons and roars at the blanks like the FUCKING HULK.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You want some? I'll smash your fucking heads in! I fucking hate this town! ALL THE BLANKS ATTACK. The brawl is fast, brutal and insa Gary swipes at the blanks with his stool, taking swigs of beer between each blow, still trying to down his pint. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Steve and Sam fight side by side, SMASHING BLANKS with th chairs. Wood splinters, heads and limbs break. Andy has turned into a rugby-boy brawler again, as he cut swathe through the blanks. Peter watches him in awe. He t to ape him, but is immediately KNOCKED DOWN and surrounde Andy smashes Peter's attacker out of the way and wrestles with him. Gary shouts from the touchline.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Twist the melon, man! Andy does so. The blank's head POPS CLEAN OFF. He uses th DETACHED HEAD to smash another blank in the face. Meanwhile, Sam is suddenly attacked by her PARTIALLY HEAD BROTHER. Steven sees this and GRABS OLIVER'S ARM. OLIVER'S ARM POPS OUT OF ITS SOCKET. Oliver then punches Steve with his remaining limb and sends him reeling throu table and onto the ground with a crash. Oliver turns back to Sam and flatly intones.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Sam, this is no way for a family to behave. Sam is roughly pushed aside. Gary, with drink in hand, attacks Oliver, swinging his stool into a devastating uppercut. He takes another swig as Oliver crashes down. Andy meanwhile RIPS ARMS and STOMPS ON FALLEN BLANKS. He such a whirlwind of anger that he splits the room, leavin Gary and Sam fighting blanks with stools on one side. Ste and Peter are trapped on the other. The pub doors swing open. And MR SHEPHERD walks in.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Okay. Break it up. Mr. Shepherd is miraculously intact again and walks back his table.

dialogues.speaker: MR SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to be like this. If only you'd see the light. Andy and the others turn to see a smiling Oliver, standin and reattaching his own arm. Masses of blanks flank him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: It's not about conflict. It's about togetherness. Mr. Shepherd sits down at the same table (next to the previous Shepherd's decapitated body). He puts his feet u and breaks out in a wide smile.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Yes. What say we try this again? How about another round? Gary finishes his drink and smashes the glass to the grou

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Nah, we’re done here.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Yes Gary, that would appear to be the case. The blanks swarm, separating the gang from each other.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Let’s go! Meet at the smokehouse.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: The smokehouse?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Just do it! Andy lifts a bench and THROWS IT THROUGH THE WINDOW. Steven sees Gary grab Sam’s hand and pull her away. She throws Steven a helpless look as they disappear upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire alarm still rings as Gary and Sam race upstairs burst into a living room, where an ELDERLY COUPLE sit. The couple advance, THEIR EYES AND MOUTH ILLUMINATED.

dialogues.speaker: HUMANS, YOU LEAVE US NO RECOURSE...
dialogues.text: Gary grabs the OLD LADY BLANK, flips her upside down and her as a battering ram to SMASH THE WINDOW. He then throw the old lady’s body back at her husband.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get on the roof. The fire alarm appears to be ringin throughout the entire town. Gary is out of ideas.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ooh look, there's my car! Let's climb down the drainpipe.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I've got a better idea. Gary jumps and lands on the roof of Sam's car, severely denting it and blowing out the windscreen.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Climb down the drainpipe. A minute later, Sam gets into the car. Gary shuts her doo

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Okay, go.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Wait. What about everybody else?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Leave 'em with me. I got this.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I always come up smiling.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don't know if that's true, Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Just go.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Will you find out what happened to my brother?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Of course, and I'll look after Stevie for you, eh? off Sam's bashful acknowledgement. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: He's a good guy, better than me.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Gary, you're not a bad person, you're just not boyfriend material. The whole ‘free spirit, quick one in the disabled toilets’ thing is kinda cool when you’re seventeen but not so much when you’re facing forty. There comes a time when you have to go forwards and not backwards.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Maybe if I hadn’t left you behind that night, it would have been different.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It's not all about that night y'know.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to be.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We'll always have the disableds though eh?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yes, we'll always have the disableds. Sam smiles and fondly kisses him on the cheek. She drives off, her damaged car RATTLING LOUDLY. Gary get up, his knees cracking. He groans, feeling his age. This attracts the attention of a BLANK who appears at the mouth of the alley, its eyes ILLUMINATING INTO SEARCHLIGH Gary disappears out of shot. We hear a jump and a crash. blank turns its searchlights to see that Gary has failed vault a fence. He gets embarrassed and disappears again. Gary hightails it to a local park, past a sign saying 'KE OFF THE GRASS' and towards the deserted bowling clubhouse  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary bursts in. Andy, Peter and Steven spin around.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Where's Sam?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I put her in her car.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN/PETER
dialogues.text: You did what?!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Put her in a car, told her to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You just sent away the only one of us sober enough to drive?!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: You just couldn’t stand the fact that she might prefer me to you.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: That’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: It is true Gary! I was getting somewhere. We held hands.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh c’mon! I was trying to help!

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Trying to help yourself more like!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Jesus, I do something right for a change and you all get on my case.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Wow, that’s the first time I’ve ever heard you admit being wrong.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I said I did something right! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Yeah ‘for a change’.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Meaning the rest of the time you’re wrong.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Not necessarily.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Arrrgghhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I just thought it would be best to get her out of harm's way.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And what about us Gary? Aren't we in harm's way?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We're alright Pete. We're The Five Musketeers.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Four Musketeers.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Wait, how do we know you put her in her car? How do we know you're you.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Of course I'm me!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yes but who the fuck are you, Gary?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I'm Gary King. There's only one Gary King. How do I know you're you?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: We've been together the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You might all not be you. How did you know that O-Man wasn't O-Man? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: His birthmark was back.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What does that prove?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Because of what Basil said. They make a copy from your DNA. That's why he had his birthmark. He was new, like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Like a man-baby.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: A 'maybe'.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Oliver with none of the shit that had happened to the real Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: The laser surgery!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: So the blanks really are blank?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: No wear and tear, no scars.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Steven, in 1987 we were playing cricket and I accidentally pushed you onto a broken bottle that nearly went up your bum.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: So show us your arse. Steven drops his trousers and bends over. He shows off an area of scar tissue just beneath his right buttock.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Very nice. Peter, when you got that 50CC Suzuki in 1988, you let me have a go and I ran over your leg. Peter gingerly pulls up the leg of his trousers, revealin perfectly intact limb. The others gasp in horror. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh wait it's my other one. Peter pulls up the other leg to reveal knotted scar tissu

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Andy, in 1986, we re-enacted the Knife Game out of Aliens and I stabbed you in the middle finger.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Or how about December 1997, when you OD'd and I drove you to hospital, four times over the limit and ended up rolling the car and almost severing my femoral artery at which point you made a miraculous recovery and ran off into the night leaving me to get arrested, after the twelve hours of life saving surgery?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Either one of those will do. Andy gives Gary the finger, revealing a distinct scar.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: What about you? Gary proudly reveals his ‘Sisters of Mercy’ tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: That could be drawn on.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Aren’t all tattoos drawn on?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Show us your arm.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Show us your arm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You came off your skateboard in fifth year and dislocated your elbow. You’ve got a scar where they put that metal plate in.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I don’t have to show you nothing. I know I’m me. If I’m not me how would I know that carved into that beam above your head are the words ‘KING GARY’?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t say “KING GARY”

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yes it does. Doesn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It says “KING GAY”.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Some cunt scrubbed out the "R"!

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: That was me.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (laughs) King Gay.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: That means fuck all anyway. Mr. Shepherd remembered stuff, so did Olly. Selective memory, remember? We haven't seen you for years and you brought us here. You better come up with some hard evidence that you're human or we're going to find out for ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh you want proof? Gary head-butts a support beam holding up the roof. BANG! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: There! That proves I'm human! He does it again several times. BANG! BANG! BANG!

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: It proves you're stupid.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Exactly! OW!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, PETER
dialogues.text: It's Gary. FOOTSTEPS OUTSIDE. They look through a window to see a BL PATROL, all using their BRIGHT EYES as searchlights.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Whole town's out looking for us.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: That's a good thing. If everyone's outside, that means nobody's inside. Come on! Gary runs out heroically, leaving the others confused.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Wait, Gary, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary sprints through a shadowy avenue of trees. The other stumble along behind.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Gary, Gary! What do you mean nobody's inside?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I mean we can still do this!

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Still do what?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: We're still on the crawl. Peter lags behind, blind drunk. He trips and steadies him on a tree. He catches his breath, then sniggers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: King Gay.

dialogues.speaker: A VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Peter? SHANE HAWKINS steps out from behind a tree, smiling benig

dialogues.speaker: SHANE HAWKINS
dialogues.text: Peter, I thought that was you. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What? Am I what?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE HAWKINS
dialogues.text: Look Peter, I know we didn't see eye to eye at school. Goodness knows I regret that. I wanted to say something back at the pub but I felt so terribly ashamed by what I'd done. Shane holds out a hand to a stunned, confused Peter.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE HAWKINS
dialogues.text: Let me make it up to you Peter, please. Up ahead, Andy and Steven catch up with Gary.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We’ve come too far, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It’s fucking suicide. Gary stops and turns to them with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’m going to get to The World’s End if it kills me... where’s Pete? They all look back and see that Peter is sat astride Shan Hawkins, PUMMELLING HIS FACE WITH HIS FISTS.

dialogues.speaker: YOU FUCKING BASTARD
dialogues.text: Horrified, the others call out in loud whispers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Peter! Leave it! Shane Hawkins reasons with Peter, as his head is smashed

dialogues.speaker: SHANE HAWKINS
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this Peter? We don’t want to hurt you...

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Come on mate! It’s not worth it! Peter puts a fist through Shane Hawkins' head, SHOUTS BAC

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yes, it fucking is!!! Peter runs off and quickly returns with AN ENORMOUS BRANC

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Peter bludgeons Shane Hawkins with the branch, but hears-

dialogues.speaker: MOTORCYCLE COP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I must say, I'm very disappointed in you Peter. The MOTORCYCLE COP steps from the shadows, shakes his hea Peter drops the branch, freaked out. A MASS OF BLANKS, stepping out from the trees and approaching from all side The eyes of the blanks GLOW IN THE DARK. Peter looks arou him. The blanks close in relentlessly and swallow him up. Andy wants to help but is dragged back by Steven and Gary

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I'll punch their lights out.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: There's too many of them Andy. The GLOWING EYED BLANKS envelop Peter, transforming their limbs into restraints around his arms and neck. The Motorcycle Cop grabs Peter's face and his hand begins glow. Peter convulses, the life draining from his face. He is beyond saving. Andy's fight ebbs away. Steven and G pull him into the shadows and out of sight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We have to go.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Gary's right.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We have to get to The King's Head.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Exactly. What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (furious) We’re not going to The King’s Head Gary. We're done. We’re going to do what we should have done in the first place, get The Beast and get out of here, we’re fucking leaving and NEVER coming back. Now, you can come with us willingly or I will knock you the fuck out and carry you there myself. Your choice.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Okay. Just think about what you’re saying. Because, you know, you have been drinking. WHAM. Andy knocks Gary the fuck out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy runs, an unconscious Gary over his shoulder. Steven follows. A BLANK PATROL forces them to hide in a car park The blank's eyes are spotlights sweeping the streets. On the other side, we see another patrol step into the li It's the FIVE TEENS from earlier. Now perfectly intact ag

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Not them again. Then from behind them, a strange and loud CLANKING OF MET

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It's modern art. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They look up to the bizarre sight of THE BRONZE SCULPTURE towering over them and walking through the town. It's who head is a large powerful spotlight searching for humans.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: We're trapped. Where's The Beast? Andy whips out the TOURIST MAP from Gary's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Uh, we're here, so The Beast is only in the next street.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: How the hell do we get to it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: We’ll have to go through.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Through where? Andy looks up at the nearest building and shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I don’t fucking believe this. Above them, swings the sign for The King’s Head. INT. THE KING’S HEAD - MOMENTS LATER Andy and Steve kick the door open. It’s deserted. Andy lays Gary unconscious on the bar, leaving the map on chest. Andy and Steven make their way to the back and see THE BEAST in the car park of the guest house next door. B Patrols run here and there, with growing frequency.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Right, we wait for an opening, then leg it to The Beast.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: We need the keys. Andy and Steve look back to Gary. Their jaws drop. Gary is awake again and standing behind the bar, pulling himself a pint. Despite a black eye, his mood seems calm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Gary, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Just a little toast. Gary raises a full pint. Andy edges forward.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Gary, put the pint down.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: To Oliver, Peter. And, you know what? Ten pubs isn't bad.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It's not but we're calling time.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: So close. Gary takes out a blue marker and crosses Pub 10 from the He then sinks his pint in one. He smacks his lips, fire i his eyes. He looks at Andy, who knows what he’s about to

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: No. Gary throws Andy his car keys, then pockets the map.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Gary! Gary LEAPS OVER the bar and runs out through the open doo

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Let him go. He left you man.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I can’t. Andy throws the car keys to Steven and takes off after Ga

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Andy leaves a shocked Steven, who looks out at The Beast.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary runs down the middle of the street towards the next GLOWING EYED blanks give chase. A huge spotlight illumina Gary, the sound of the BRONZE SCULPTURE growing closer. Andy too is on Gary’s tail, screaming at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Come back you stupid bastard! Gary barges aside blanks, intent on reaching his goal. We see familiar faces from earlier among the blanks: The VARIOUS PASSERSBY, all THE PUBLICANS they've met. He rips the arm off PUBLICAN 1 and knocks the head off PUBLICAN 3 with the severed limb. As he nears the eleventh pub, he runs over a picnic table and kicks the MOTORCYCLE COP in the face on the way down. Andy knocks aside attackers with the same ferocity. He se Gary up ahead, ducking into The Hole in the Wall. We follow Andy as he makes his way towards the pub, DODGI AND FIGHTING BLANKS of all apparent ages and sizes. The BRONZE SCULPTURE suddenly stands in Andy's path. He s underneath the legs without breaking his run. Andy then rips the arms from two of THE TEENS and smashes another two with the same dismembered limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy enters The Hole in the Wall at such speed, the door flies off its hinges. Gary is already behind the bar, rai a pint to his lips, he sees Andy and knows he must act fa

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Andy look out! TWO BLANKS pounce on Andy from behind. He barely turns to swiftly and furiously dispatch them with the severed limb Andy makes toward Gary but hears the ROAR OF AN ENGINE. THE BEAST SMASHES THROUGH THE WALL. Steven is at the whee We see SWARMS OF BLANKS approaching the new hole in the w (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Gary, Andy, get the fuck in!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You heard him, Andy. Gary finishes his pint, crosses 11 off his map and runs f back window. He DIVES THROUGH THE GLASS, smashing it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: We don’t have much- BANG. TEEN 1 jumps onto the Beast’s roof. Like Andy it ha adopted the dismembered limbs as clubs. It flips down to ground to face Steven as another blank rips the car door A jagged shape smashes through the back window. The BRONZ SCULPTURE pulls the Beast back outside with its limbs.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Steven! The Beast is overwhelmed with blanks. The Teen jumps down menace Andy as the Bronze Sculpture shatters the windscre

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Andy! Go! Now! Andy has no option but to follow Gary through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy lands and rolls on the tarmac. Up ahead he sees: Gary, sprinting uphill towards THE WORLD’S END. Andy foll The wind whips against Gary. The TOURIST MAP blows out of jacket and flies into the air landing in Andy’s face. As he casts it aside, Andy sees the Marmalade Sandwich approaching fast. He barges into Tracy Benson, knocking h flying. He shoulder charges Erica Leekes then sees - Becky Salt. No glowing eyes. Looking absolutely perfect.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY SALT
dialogues.text: I want you inside me Andy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Andy plunges his fist into Becky's stomach. His hand emer covered in blue stuff, wedding ring between finger and th He places it back on his finger and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE WORLD'S END
dialogues.text: A single full pint stands alone on a table. Behind it, th door bursts open to reveal Gary, mad, panting. He approac the drink as though it were the holy grail. An eerie silence in the bar, as though the world has been reduced to just Gary and the pint. He raises it to his li SMACK! It's Andy. He slaps the glass from Gary's hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You've had enough!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: This is it, Andy! This is The World's End!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I know! Furious, Gary runs towards the bar. Andy tries to stop hi An angry fight ensues.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Stop! This! Now! Andy throws Gary through a table to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Leave me alone! What do you care?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Of course I fucking care. There's a reason I'm angry at you, you idiot!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I KNOW why you're angry but it's not MY fault you crashed and it's not even MY fault that I ran off, that was the fucking drugs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I don't care about that. It's not the point. I got better. You didn't. You let me down man. That's why I'm angry. You were Gary King. Gary fucking King. I believed in you. I would have followed you to the fucking end. Jesus, I have!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Then stop following me! Gary pushes Andy away and runs for the bar. Andy grabs Ga trenchcoat and they scrabble on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What's it like to be happy, Andy?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You've got everything you want. Your perfect job, your perfect house, your perfect wife.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You think it's all perfect? She left me Gary. Do you honestly believe I'd be here if I didn't have an empty house? She took the kids to her mum's three weeks ago. Said I'm not "present" enough. You think I gave up? No, I'm trying to win her back. God know's, I'm losing but I'm gonna keep fighting Gary, because that's how we survive. For fuck's sake, I just punched my wedding ring out of a robot's tummy.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Exactly! You keep fighting for what’s important.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: What’s so important about The Golden Mile?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It’s all I’ve got! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gary scrambles over the bar. Andy grabs the belt on the b of his trench and it rips off. Andy tumbles backwards. Gary gets behind the bar and grabs a glass. He’s about to pull himself a pint when Andy grabs him and pulls him awa the coat. Gary desperately wriggles out of his trench-coat and thro punch. Andy catches it. Gary’s sleeve drops, revealing a bandaged wrist.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You need help Gary. Andy grabs the other hand, revealing not only another ban but a hospital ID bracelet. Realisation dawns. Gary pushes a shocked Andy onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I got help. You know what help was? Help was a lot of people, sitting in a circle talking about how bad things had got. That is not my idea of a good time.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: And this is? It can’t all be a good time, things have to be bad sometimes, otherwise you’1l never know how ‘good’ really feels.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: They told me when to go to bed, Andy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Gary, mate, you can’t get drunk unless you’re sober.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I DON’T WANT TO BE SOBER! Gary stands and takes a second glass from the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It never got better, Andy. It never got better than that night. It was supposed to be the beginning of my life. All that promise and fucking optimism. That feeling that we could take on the whole universe. It was a big lie. NOTHING HAPPENED! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With determination Gary places the glass under the tap.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You don't need to do this Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. He pulls the pump. CLICK. No liquid emerges but - The World's End itself begins to RUMBLE AND SHAKE. The foundations vibrate, the glasses rattling furiously. Gary looks at Andy like a naughty schoolboy. Oh shit. Suddenly the entire bar and pub floor and bar sinks into ground. It's as if the pub has become an elevator, going into the darkest depths of the Earth. Then with a BOOM - The elevator hits the bottom. Behind the bar, hide Gary a Andy who look out to see-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A section of the pub sits in a dark chamber underneath Ne Haven. Cables and pipes line the walls, evidence of the active network. Only the shaft of light from the World's above lights the sunken pub floor below. There is a DEEP HUM. Gary and Andy peer into the darkness the surrounding chamber. Around them, on two higher ledge the chamber, stand a SHADOWY CIRCLE OF BLANKS looking dow Gary lifts up the bar to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Gary, don't go out there- As soon as Gary steps out, a THUNDERING VOICE BOOMS.

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: Gary King. It is the WELL SPOKEN VOICE, amplified to a GODLIKE SURRO

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Suddenly the blanks' EYES ILLUMINATE and they collectivel project an ENORMOUS COLUMN OF BLINDING LIGHT in the centr the chamber. It hums and pulsates. Gary squints upwards. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: Gary King, of the humans.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: We want to help you Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Do you now? The LIGHT takes the form of an all-seeing, incandescent e transforming in time with the sound of its own voice.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: We are here to enable your full potential as we have with countless worlds across the galaxy. The Light becomes a powerpoint demonstration of the galax Many planets are highlighted; the furthest out is Earth.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? How'd you manage that then? Peter steps out from the shadowy circle, now a smiling bl who speaks in the same WELL SPOKEN VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We appropriate a small percentage of the population at two thousand or so penetration points across the planet to ensure maximum coverage. OLIVER steps out, head intact, speaking with the same WEL SPOKEN VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: From there, we create ‘simulants’ to spread our ideologies through peaceful indoctrination. We see a graphic of Earth. Points appear across the globe with concentric circles growing outwards to show coverage Mr. Shepherd steps out to talk in the same VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Our objective is simple, to ready the population for participation in our galactic community. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: This method requires a small sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: But the fewer replacements we make, the more successful we consider our operation. The Reverend, steps forward, now speaking with the VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVEREND
dialogues.text: Of course we welcome those who volunteer themselves. And now Shane Hawkins appears too. Head intact again.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE HAWKINS
dialogues.text: We can offer attractive incentives to those who willingly combine. The Marmalade Sandwich step out and talk in unison.

dialogues.speaker: THE MARMALADE SANDWICH
dialogues.text: The chance to be young again and yet retain selected memories.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Isn't that something you'd like?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Something you've always wanted? Now stepping out of the shadowy circle are FIVE INDIVIDUA The 18-YEAR-OLD VERSIONS of PETER, OLIVER, STEVEN, ANDY a GARY. They are exactly as we saw them in the prologue.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh my god! I'm so cute! I'd fuck me. YOUNG GARY steps down onto the floor and approaches Gary, opening his arms to his older counterpart.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GARY
dialogues.text: The beauty of our system is that we all win. There are no losers. Gary is seemingly enthralled. Young Gary smiles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GARY
dialogues.text: Allow me to carry your legend forward. Let the man you have become be the boy you were. Gary places his hands on the shoulders of Young Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Nah. WITH SUDDEN VIOLENCE GARY POPS OFF YOUNG GARY'S HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: There's only one Gary King. He drop kicks the head and it splats against the chamber wall. The Light intensifies, the hum growing in volume.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: Then you have made your choice Gary, King of the Humans. Gary puffs out his chest. He is King Of The Humans, a dru representative speaking for Earth.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah I have. Because frankly, who the fuck are you to come down here and tell us what to do?

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: We are The Network and we are here for your betterment. In the last twenty-three years, have you not marvelled as information technology has surged forward?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: Earth has grown smaller yet greater as connectivity has grown. This is our doing and it is just the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh fuck off, you big lamp.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: You are children and you require guidance. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There is no room for imperfection if Earth is to be a successful member of our society.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Hey, Earth ain't perfect, humans aren't perfect and guess what? I ain't perfect.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: And therein lies the necessity for this intervention. Must the galaxy be subjected to an entire planet of people like you? Andy steps into the arena as Gary's drunk lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa whoa, who put you in charge? Who are you to criticize anyone? Gary might be a bit of a cock and in fact he is a bit of a cock but he's my cock.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Thanks mate.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Now I'm not going to lie and say this man is some sort of shining example, far from it. And I'm not saying that it's wrong to ask for help, it's not. But help must be asked for, otherwise it's just control.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: But he is a detriment to himself, just as Earth is a detriment to the galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: You act out the same cycles of self destruction again and again. At this point your planet is the least civilized in the entire galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What did he say? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: He’s saying we’re a bunch of fuck ups.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s our basic human right to be fuck ups. This civilisation is founded on fuck ups and you know what? That makes me proud.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: And me!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What is it they say, to err is...?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: To err is human.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: They say to err is human, so errr-

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: We do not believe you speak for all humanity. You are but two men. Two drunk men.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Three drunk men! Steven abseils down from the World's End on a piece of bunting. He's bloodied and battered but very much alive.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Stevie-baby! Gary and Andy cheer as Steven lands on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: Enough, humans!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh, you're in trouble now. It's only the fucking Three Musketeers.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: You are revolting against the wisdom of countless solar systems.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah we are revolting! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: You said it, mate. Gary appeals to the surrounding throng.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Come on, we don't have to stand for this shit? Who's with us? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Anybody?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Wait, you said you're not here to conquer, can I just ask, out of interest, how many people did you have to replace in Newton Haven?

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: That is irrelevant.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Is it? Hands up who here is human. Mumbling from the circle. One hand goes up.

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: I’m human.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: One!

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: And me.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: That’s two. Another voice pipes up from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: I am but don’t know for how long. Gary, Andy and Steven are delighted to see Basil and chee

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: So what’s that? Three? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You had to replace an entire town?

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: Not the whole town.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Everyone except old nutball and the shifty twins.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: That’s a good name for the band Gary. You should write that down.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: What happened to the ones you replaced? Like Oliver and Pete?

dialogues.speaker: BASIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I told you not to ask that!

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: Redundant vessels are recycled, mulched and converted into fertilizer whereupon they are returned to the earth to promote verdancy and growth. It is a highly efficient means of organic renewal. The Light presents cheery graphics of the 'recycling'.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Mulched! ?

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: It is a relative few in light of our long term plan.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: You mean the few hundred thousand turned to fucking compost?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: And what about the other places? The penetration points. Gary sniggers and makes a euphemistic hand gesture. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Are they as “successful” as Newton Haven? Because I’m guessing we’re not the only glitch in your system.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: It is true, The Network has been experiencing some difficulties...

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: You better believe it big balls.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: ... and we hope to resolve these as soon as is conveniently possible.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I think you’ve bitten off more than you can chew with Earth, mate.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Because we are more belligerent, more stubborn, more idiotic than you can possibly imagine and I’m not just talking about Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: There’s more than one Gary King.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: But you said...

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I fucking know what I fucking said!

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: Your reliance on profanity is a measure of your immaturity as a man and a species.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh why don’t you just get back in your rocket and fuck off to Legoland you cunts!

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, stop Starbucking us man.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: It is our duty to challenge you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Just eff off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, eff the fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: We cannot permit the human race to continue unsupervised.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: We're not asking your permission.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, leave us to our own devices you intergalactic arseholes.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: You misunderstand-

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh shut up.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: We are trying-

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Nobody's listening!

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: If you’d only-

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Face it, we’re the human race and we don’t like being told what to do. A pause. The Light collects itself. Then asks.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: Just what is it that you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We wanna be free. We wanna be free, to do what we want to do and we want to get loaded and we wanna have a good time. And that’s what we’re gonna do. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: It is pointless arguing with you. You will be left... to your own devices. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Really? And with that... THE LIGHT SUDDENLY SWITCHES OFF. Blackne We hear the sound of an OLD FASHIONED DIAL TONE, that develops into a LOUD RUMBLE as the catacombs start to sha

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: They fucked off. Result! Gary, Andy and Steve cheer and celebrate. They look to se that the blanks in the circle are inert and dead eyed. The blanks power down and some keel backwards like domino BANG! Sparks fizz from the cables like fireworks. Andy an Steven's smiles fade as the pipes glow a dangerous red.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Andy, perhaps we should-

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Gary, let's boo-boo. BANG! A huge electrical explosion erupts behind Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's shit here innit? A pipe falls from the ceiling, narrowly missing Gary and crushing the static Oliver instead. The catacombs are now lit only by a growing blaze. The ga followed by Basil and the Collaborators make a break for escaping up a ladder at the side of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they emerge from the World's End, Gary looks up to see World's End sign on fire. Beyond, the pub itself throbs f inside with a powerful red light. They look around to see Newton Haven: Smoke-filled, fires starting everywhere, the sky turning an ominous red. The few remaining humans climb out and run away fast.

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: Well done. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: Thanks a bunch!

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 1
dialogues.text: You had to go and spoil it!

dialogues.speaker: COLLABORATOR 2
dialogues.text: Yeah, happy now? Basil appears last.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Basil, what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: BASIL
dialogues.text: Same as before. Go! Basil disappears into the smoke, leaving our Three Musketeers, lost amidst the gathering apocalypse.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Where’s The Beast.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: The Beast is dead, mate.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
