dialogues.text: You know what’s really annoying?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I promised myself I wouldn’t die in this town. Gary hears a familiar RATTLING approach through the smoke

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You're not going to. HEADLIGHTS. Gary runs towards them, waving his arms.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Our luck just changed. BOOM. The car runs into Gary, knocking him violently down

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh crumbs! Sorry! Sam pulls up, visible through her broken windscreen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Sam? You came back for us!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes I did. Well, I got lost on the ring-road. But yes. Gary gets to his feet and limps over to Sam’s car.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Hi Sam, could you give us a lift to London please?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Did you find out what happened to my brother?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Uh... we’ll tell you on the way. They get in the car and hastily buckle up.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Do excuse the mess. I’ve been meaning to clear that up.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We forgive you. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Which way? A FIERY FLASH and OMINOUS BOOM explodes from the World’s A HUGE WAVE OF RED PLASMA detonates outward towards the c

dialogues.speaker: BACKWARDS
dialogues.text: The ENERGY WAVE gains on them, shattering all the nearby windows, causing destruction and chaos. Sam reverses fast, pulls a spectacular J-turn and speeds of Newton Haven. In the slipstream of Sam’s car, Gary’s tourist map is whi into the air where it bursts into flames, enveloped by th plasma wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam approaches the same roundabout she got lost on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Which way now?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Straight over! Sam floors it, speeding right OVER THE ROUNDABOUT and awa from the town on a winding country lane.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We can make it. The plasma wave gains inexorably, igniting the hedgerows the car struggles to outrun its fate. Sam drives to escap the burning countryside, a RAPIDLY GAINING TUNNEL OF FIRE

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We're gonna make it. Sam's car is just ahead of the gaining fire as it shoots the sign saying 'THANKS FOR VISITING NEWTON HAVEN'.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We made it! Not quite. The flames of the hedgerows overtake the car. passengers are engulfed in a BLINDING RED GLOW. Then- BLACKNESS. We hear coughing. We see the car through a cloud of acrid smoke, blackened but intact. Sam turns the key. It is dea The gang exits the car and start to walk. Gary leads them stumbling toward an orange light in the distance. Andy follows, Steven and Sam behind him, holding hands. The smoke clears and Gary gazes upon the same panorama he in 1990. The valley bathed in orange light. However, it i not the dawn, it's the town and surrounding fields on fir The flaming hedgerows make a fiery grid as far as they ca see. A nearby pylon blazes, showering sparks. They sit do on the brow of the hill looking out across the scene. Gary turns to Andy.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I know. Andy puts his arm around Gary. They sit regarding Armaged

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older Andy talks to a group of younger people around a fire. He is dressed in a medieval looking mish-mash of contemporary clothing. The look and feel of these scenes post apocalyptic and neo-gothic, with much swirling smoke

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: That morning gave new meaning to the word 'hangover'. We decided to walk it off, all the way back to London, but the headache didn't end there - it just went on and on. When The Network went down, it triggered a pulse that wiped out all our technology and sent us here, back to the Dark Ages. We see the Earth reflected in Andy's glasses, we see puls waves spread out all over the globe and then... black out

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: There were casualties of course. I knew a few. Some guy at work, my cousin, Gary's mum. Nobody could be sure how many we lost, because we never heard from the rest of the world again. Things aren't connected like they used to be. Everyone got cut off. We see Andy on his property with his wife and kids, tendi an area of arable land, surrounded by a chain link fence.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Some people say it was better when they were here. I can see that. It isn't easy now but it is simpler. I'm back with the wife which is something. We decided our problems didn't seem as bad in the grand scheme. We live off the land, provide for the family. We all had to go organic in a big way, but if I'm honest, I'm hard pressed to recall any processed foods I miss. A MINT CORNETTO WRAPPER flutters onto the fence and then flies away. Andy's slavering chops betray him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: As for the blanks, well a funny thing happened there. They woke up. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A week or so after The Network pulled out, they just sort of rebooted by themselves. We see blackened figures in the burnt out catacombs come life. The blanks awake. Peter blinks. Oliver sits up to discover that his head is missing once again. He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: They seemed lost at first, children cut off from their parents. I felt a bit sorry for them to be honest. The blanks stumble through society. Some are pelted with tomatoes. Some reunite with tearful relatives. Oliver pas graffiti reading ‘WE ARE NOT ROBOTS’. He gets dirty looks from passersby. He gives them the finger, mouths “fuck of

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: The Network was right about one thing. We don’t play nice with others. The Network was right about a few things to be fair. Oliver went back to being an estate agent. People still need a roof over their heads and the old Olly always had a gift for the gab. I guess the new one has too. Oliver, now wearing half a football in place of his missi head, shows a young couple into a rough dwelling. He attempts to follow them but bumps into the door jamb.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I hear the Petertron went home. He remembered enough to know where Bishop’s Gardens was. I suppose he just picked up where he left off. We see Peter approach his now overgrown and half-shuttere house in Bishop’s Gardens.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I’m not sure his wife noticed. Maybe she chose not to. He’s a pretty good dad by all accounts. We see Peter sat round the breakfast table with his kids burnt out kitchen. He takes off his hand and lets it scut round the table. Everyone laughs. His wife enters, Peter quickly reattaches his hand and winks at his children. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Steven and Sam got together in the end. Didn’t see that coming. They shacked up just outside London. It’s a pretty nice shack too. Sam and Steven appear on the doorstep of an impressive looking shack. Sam kisses Steven who slings a shotgun ove his shoulder and strides off, presumably to go hunting.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: As for Gary? Andy looks ruefully into the distance as he remembers his friend, almost forgetting he is addressing the group.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I don’t know what happened to Gary. We got separated and I never saw him again. Some say he went back to Newton Haven. I don’t know why, I think his business there was done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Gary, striding out of the smoke, still dressed in trench coat, which seems somehow more befitting in these surroundings. He carries a broadsword on his back.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Wherever he is, I hope he’s happy. It’s funny but I miss him. I wonder if he misses me. Striding behind him, the BLANK TEENAGE VERSIONS OF ANDY, STEVEN, OLIVER AND PETER. They are somewhat blackened, wi modifications to their garb. They too carry medieval weap Gary leads them to a pub that stands alone in the smoky apocalyptic wasteland: ‘THE RISING SUN’ He brings them to a halt at the door of the pub and regar the sign made out of number plates. It reads ‘NO BL4 NKS’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign clatters across the pub floor drawing looks from group of armed, rough-looking and very human patrons.

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN PATRON 1
dialogues.text: Blank bastards. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN PATRON 2
dialogues.text: Fucking robots. Gary and his gang of blanks approach the bar and a public who eyes them with absolute disdain.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Five waters please.

dialogues.speaker: PUBLICAN 13
dialogues.text: You can have one but I'm not serving this scum. Gary notes the air of tension in the room and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Well I'm afraid it's all for one and one for all. You see my friends and I are on an adventure, a quest if you will and since we find ourselves in need of refreshment, you sir have the honour of drawing first blood. So I'll ask you again, for the last time. Tension rises. The patrons seem ready to attack.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Five. Waters. Please. The Publican reaches for a weapon. So does every patron i the bar. With lightning speed, Gary draws his sword and h wingmen fall into combat formation behind him.

dialogues.speaker: PUBLICAN 13
dialogues.text: Who the hell do you think you are?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Me? Behind Gary, the eyes of his blank posse switch on and GL BRIGHTLY, backlighting Gary's final, badass line.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: They call me The King. Gary charges at the camera. Things are about to get messy
